decks.notes: The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The deck also utilizes a variety of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to control the board and generate card advantage. By efficiently controlling the opponent's threats and resources, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver them in a longer game, ultimately emerging victorious through strategic gameplay and resource management.

This deck focuses on using disruptive creatures and spells to control your opponent's board while also developing your own board presence. By utilizing cards like Sanctifier en-Vec, Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, and Solitude, you can hinder your opponent's game plan while advancing your own. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending to further disrupt your opponent's strategy. The goal is to apply pressure and disrupt your opponent's game plan, leading to a favorable board position and ultimately securing the win.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with creatures and spells, then using instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand onto the battlefield. The deck also utilizes cards like Ephemerate and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, it includes cards like Faithful Mending for card advantage and filtering, creating a versatile and resilient combo deck that can win through various means.

This combo deck focuses on protecting yourself with enchantments like Solemnity, Phyrexian Unlife, and Nine Lives. The key concept is to create an impenetrable defense with cards like Sterling Grove and Greater Auramancy while using cards like Thoughtseize and Nevermore to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Wheel of Sun and Moon ensures that you can recycle your key enchantments if needed. The deck also includes ways to find your combo pieces efficiently with cards like United Battlefront and Pest Control. Overall, the deck aims to set up an unbeatable defense and outlast your opponent.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents and control the board. The key strategy is to establish early board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, while using Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to buff your creatures and protect them from removal spells. Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco provide powerful finishers to seal the game. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively through aggressive plays and smart creature management.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing a wide range of mana colors for flexibility and power. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide early aggression, while Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding offer protection and disruption. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Scion of Draco to seal the deal. With a mix of creature threats and burn spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand and using cards like Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back for devastating impact. It also utilizes cards like Consign to Memory, Faithful Mending, and Solitude to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents. With a mix of control elements and instant speed reanimation, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on leveraging artifact synergy to quickly overwhelm the opponent with early aggression. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to generate mana, the deck can deploy threats quickly and efficiently. Cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and help maintain tempo. Additionally, removal spells like Engineered Explosives and Pinnacle Emissary help control the board while maintaining pressure. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize or answer the threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to deploy creatures like Voice of Victory and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury along with powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, to deal direct damage to the opponent's life total. Using cards like Solitude for removal and Goblin Bombardment for additional reach, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent and efficient casting of spells.

The key concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to deal direct damage to the opponent or remove threats. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that aggression throughout, using cards like Mutagenic Growth and Slickshot Show-Off to pump up its creatures and push for lethal damage. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Preordain and Expressive Iteration to help maintain its momentum.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifacts and using them to power up creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Kappa Cannoneer. By efficiently utilizing mana ramp cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum, as well as powerful equipment like Cranial Plating, the deck can overwhelm opponents with aggressive creatures and combat tricks. The inclusion of cards like Sink into Stupor and Weapons Manufacturing allows for disruption and additional damage to opponents, making it a versatile and aggressive deck that can quickly take control of the game.

This deck focuses on using UrzaTron lands to ramp up quickly and cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers to control the game. Devourer of Destiny and Glaring Fleshraker provide early threats, while Karn, the Great Creator locks down opponent's artifacts. Kozilek's Command and Thought-Knot Seer disrupt opponent's hands. Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Mind Stone generate card advantage and provide removal. The deck's win condition is to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and planeswalkers while controlling the game with efficient removal and disruption.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Simic Growth Chamber, while utilizing Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate more mana. The goal is to search for and play Primeval Titan to fetch lands like Vesuva and Lotus Field, enabling explosive plays with cards like Scapeshift to search for multiple lands at once. The deck also includes utility lands like Tolaria West and Boseiju, Who Endures to support the combo and protect against counterspells. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and win condition.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. With cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, the deck can quickly establish a threatening board presence. Consign to Memory and Goblin Bombardment provide removal and additional reach to finish off the opponent. Voice of Victory and Quantum Riddler can disrupt the opponent's plans, while Prismatic Ending offers versatile removal. The deck aims to apply pressure and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to boost its creatures' power and protect them from removal. By controlling the board and applying constant pressure, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent while also generating card advantage through card draw and library manipulation. It aims to build a board presence with aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also utilizing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the battlefield. The deck also incorporates pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to further increase the pressure on the opponent and close out games quickly.
